49typedef hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> script_langsys_map;
50#ifndef HB_NO_SUBSET_CFF
51static inline bool
52_add_cff_seac_components (const OT::cff1::accelerator_t &cff,
53 hb_codepoint_t gid,
54 hb_set_t *gids_to_retain)
55{
56 hb_codepoint_t base_gid, accent_gid;
57 if (cff.get_seac_components (glyph: gid, base: &base_gid, accent: &accent_gid))
58 {
59 gids_to_retain->add (g: base_gid);
60 gids_to_retain->add (g: accent_gid);
61 return true;
62 }
63 return false;
64}
65#endif
66
67static void
68_remap_palette_indexes (const hb_set_t *palette_indexes,
69 hb_map_t *mapping /* OUT */)
70{
71 unsigned new_idx = 0;
72 for (unsigned palette_index : palette_indexes->iter ())
73 {
74 if (palette_index == 0xFFFF)
75 {
76 mapping->set (key: palette_index, value&: palette_index);
77 continue;
78 }
79 mapping->set (key: palette_index, value&: new_idx);
80 new_idx++;
81 }
82}
83
84static void
85_remap_indexes (const hb_set_t *indexes,
86 hb_map_t *mapping /* OUT */)
87{
88 for (auto _ : + hb_enumerate (indexes->iter ()))
89 mapping->set (key: _.second, value&: _.first);
90
91}
92
93#ifndef HB_NO_SUBSET_LAYOUT
94
95/*
96 * Removes all tags from 'tags' that are not in filter. Additionally eliminates any duplicates.
97 * Returns true if anything was removed (not including duplicates).
98 */
99static bool _filter_tag_list(hb_vector_t<hb_tag_t>* tags, /* IN/OUT */
100 const hb_set_t* filter)
101{
102 hb_vector_t<hb_tag_t> out;
103 out.alloc (size: tags->get_size() + 1); // +1 is to allocate room for the null terminator.
104
105 bool removed = false;
106 hb_set_t visited;
107
108 for (hb_tag_t tag : *tags)
109 {
110 if (!tag) continue;
111 if (visited.has (k: tag)) continue;
112
113 if (!filter->has (k: tag))
114 {
115 removed = true;
116 continue;
117 }
118
119 visited.add (g: tag);
120 out.push (v&: tag);
121 }
122
123 // The collect function needs a null element to signal end of the array.
124 out.push (HB_TAG_NONE);
125
126 hb_swap (out, *tags);
127 return removed;
128}
129
130template <typename T>
131static void _collect_layout_indices (hb_subset_plan_t *plan,
132 const T& table,
133 hb_set_t *lookup_indices, /* OUT */
134 hb_set_t *feature_indices, /* OUT */
135 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::shared_ptr<hb_set_t>> *feature_record_cond_idx_map, /* OUT */
136 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, const OT::Feature*> *feature_substitutes_map /* OUT */)
137{
138 unsigned num_features = table.get_feature_count ();
139 hb_vector_t<hb_tag_t> features;
140 if (!plan->check_success (success: features.resize (size_: num_features))) return;
141 table.get_feature_tags (0, &num_features, features.arrayZ);
142 bool retain_all_features = !_filter_tag_list (tags: &features, filter: &plan->layout_features);
143
144 unsigned num_scripts = table.get_script_count ();
145 hb_vector_t<hb_tag_t> scripts;
146 if (!plan->check_success (success: scripts.resize (size_: num_scripts))) return;
147 table.get_script_tags (0, &num_scripts, scripts.arrayZ);
148 bool retain_all_scripts = !_filter_tag_list (tags: &scripts, filter: &plan->layout_scripts);
149
150 if (!plan->check_success (success: !features.in_error ()) || !features
151 || !plan->check_success (success: !scripts.in_error ()) || !scripts)
152 return;
153
154 hb_ot_layout_collect_features (plan->source,
155 T::tableTag,
156 retain_all_scripts ? nullptr : scripts.arrayZ,
157 nullptr,
158 retain_all_features ? nullptr : features.arrayZ,
159 feature_indices);
160
161#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
162 // collect feature substitutes with variations
163 if (!plan->user_axes_location.is_empty ())
164 {
165 hb_hashmap_t<hb::shared_ptr<hb_map_t>, unsigned> conditionset_map;
166 OT::hb_collect_feature_substitutes_with_var_context_t c =
167 {
168 .axes_index_tag_map: &plan->axes_old_index_tag_map,
169 .axes_location: &plan->axes_location,
170 .record_cond_idx_map: feature_record_cond_idx_map,
171 .feature_substitutes_map: feature_substitutes_map,
172 .feature_indices: feature_indices,
173 .apply: true,
174 .cur_record_idx: 0,
175 .conditionset_map: &conditionset_map
176 };
177 table.collect_feature_substitutes_with_variations (&c);
178 }
179#endif
180
181 for (unsigned feature_index : *feature_indices)
182 {
183 const OT::Feature* f = &(table.get_feature (feature_index));
184 const OT::Feature **p = nullptr;
185 if (feature_substitutes_map->has (key: feature_index, vp: &p))
186 f = *p;
187
188 f->add_lookup_indexes_to (lookup_indexes: lookup_indices);
189 }
190
191 // If all axes are pinned then all feature variations will be dropped so there's no need
192 // to collect lookups from them.
193 if (!plan->all_axes_pinned)
194 {
195 // TODO(qxliu76): this collection doesn't work correctly for feature variations that are dropped
196 // but not applied. The collection will collect and retain the lookup indices
197 // associated with those dropped but not activated rules. Since partial instancing
198 // isn't yet supported this isn't an issue yet but will need to be fixed for
199 // partial instancing.
200 table.feature_variation_collect_lookups (feature_indices, feature_substitutes_map, lookup_indices);
201 }
202}
203
204
205static inline void
206_GSUBGPOS_find_duplicate_features (const OT::GSUBGPOS &g,
207 const hb_map_t *lookup_indices,
208 const hb_set_t *feature_indices,
209 const hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, const OT::Feature*> *feature_substitutes_map,
210 hb_map_t *duplicate_feature_map /* OUT */)
211{
212 if (feature_indices->is_empty ()) return;
213 hb_hashmap_t<hb_tag_t, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t>> unique_features;
214 //find out duplicate features after subset
215 for (unsigned i : feature_indices->iter ())
216 {
217 hb_tag_t t = g.get_feature_tag (i);
218 if (t == HB_MAP_VALUE_INVALID) continue;
219 if (!unique_features.has (key: t))
220 {
221 if (unlikely (!unique_features.set (t, hb::unique_ptr<hb_set_t> {hb_set_create ()})))
222 return;
223 if (unique_features.has (key: t))
224 unique_features.get (key: t)->add (g: i);
225 duplicate_feature_map->set (key: i, value&: i);
226 continue;
227 }
228
229 bool found = false;
230
231 hb_set_t* same_tag_features = unique_features.get (key: t);
232 for (unsigned other_f_index : same_tag_features->iter ())
233 {
234 const OT::Feature* f = &(g.get_feature (i));
235 const OT::Feature **p = nullptr;
236 if (feature_substitutes_map->has (key: i, vp: &p))
237 f = *p;
238
239 const OT::Feature* other_f = &(g.get_feature (i: other_f_index));
240 if (feature_substitutes_map->has (key: other_f_index, vp: &p))
241 other_f = *p;
242
243 auto f_iter =
244 + hb_iter (f->lookupIndex)
245 | hb_filter (lookup_indices)
246 ;
247
248 auto other_f_iter =
249 + hb_iter (other_f->lookupIndex)
250 | hb_filter (lookup_indices)
251 ;
252
253 bool is_equal = true;
254 for (; f_iter && other_f_iter; f_iter++, other_f_iter++)
255 {
256 unsigned a = *f_iter;
257 unsigned b = *other_f_iter;
258 if (a != b) { is_equal = false; break; }
259 }
260
261 if (is_equal == false || f_iter || other_f_iter) continue;
262
263 found = true;
264 duplicate_feature_map->set (key: i, value&: other_f_index);
265 break;
266 }
267
268 if (found == false)
269 {
270 same_tag_features->add (g: i);
271 duplicate_feature_map->set (key: i, value&: i);
272 }
273 }
274}
275
276template <typename T>
277static inline void
278_closure_glyphs_lookups_features (hb_subset_plan_t *plan,
279 hb_set_t *gids_to_retain,
280 hb_map_t *lookups,
281 hb_map_t *features,
282 script_langsys_map *langsys_map,
283 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, hb::shared_ptr<hb_set_t>> *feature_record_cond_idx_map,
284 hb_hashmap_t<unsigned, const OT::Feature*> *feature_substitutes_map)
285{
286 hb_blob_ptr_t<T> table = plan->source_table<T> ();
287 hb_tag_t table_tag = table->tableTag;
288 hb_set_t lookup_indices, feature_indices;
289 _collect_layout_indices<T> (plan,
290 *table,
291 &lookup_indices,
292 &feature_indices,
293 feature_record_cond_idx_map,
294 feature_substitutes_map);
295
296 if (table_tag == HB_OT_TAG_GSUB)
297 hb_ot_layout_lookups_substitute_closure (face: plan->source,
298 lookups: &lookup_indices,
299 glyphs: gids_to_retain);
300 table->closure_lookups (plan->source,
301 gids_to_retain,
302 &lookup_indices);
303 _remap_indexes (indexes: &lookup_indices, mapping: lookups);
304
305 // prune features
306 table->prune_features (lookups,
307 plan->user_axes_location.is_empty () ? nullptr : feature_record_cond_idx_map,
308 feature_substitutes_map,
309 &feature_indices);
310 hb_map_t duplicate_feature_map;
311 _GSUBGPOS_find_duplicate_features (*table, lookups, &feature_indices, feature_substitutes_map, &duplicate_feature_map);
312
313 feature_indices.clear ();
314 table->prune_langsys (&duplicate_feature_map, &plan->layout_scripts, langsys_map, &feature_indices);
315 _remap_indexes (indexes: &feature_indices, mapping: features);
316
317 table.destroy ();
318}
319
320#endif
321
322#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
323static inline void
324_generate_varstore_inner_maps (const hb_set_t& varidx_set,
325 unsigned subtable_count,
326 hb_vector_t<hb_inc_bimap_t> &inner_maps /* OUT */)
327{
328 if (varidx_set.is_empty () || subtable_count == 0) return;
329
330 inner_maps.resize (size_: subtable_count);
331 for (unsigned idx : varidx_set)
332 {
333 uint16_t major = idx >> 16;
334 uint16_t minor = idx & 0xFFFF;
335
336 if (major >= subtable_count)
337 continue;
338 inner_maps[major].add (lhs: minor);
339 }
340}
341
342static inline hb_font_t*
343_get_hb_font_with_variations (const hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
344{
345 hb_font_t *font = hb_font_create (face: plan->source);
346
347 hb_vector_t<hb_variation_t> vars;
348 vars.alloc (size: plan->user_axes_location.get_population ());
349
350 for (auto _ : plan->user_axes_location)
351 {
352 hb_variation_t var;
353 var.tag = _.first;
354 var.value = _.second;
355 vars.push (v&: var);
356 }
357
358#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
359 hb_font_set_variations (font, variations: vars.arrayZ, variations_length: plan->user_axes_location.get_population ());
360#endif
361 return font;
362}
363
364static inline void
365_collect_layout_variation_indices (hb_subset_plan_t* plan)
366{
367 hb_blob_ptr_t<OT::GDEF> gdef = plan->source_table<OT::GDEF> ();
368 hb_blob_ptr_t<GPOS> gpos = plan->source_table<GPOS> ();
369
370 if (!gdef->has_data ())
371 {
372 gdef.destroy ();
373 gpos.destroy ();
374 return;
375 }
376
377 const OT::VariationStore *var_store = nullptr;
378 hb_set_t varidx_set;
379 hb_font_t *font = nullptr;
380 float *store_cache = nullptr;
381 bool collect_delta = plan->pinned_at_default ? false : true;
382 if (collect_delta)
383 {
384 font = _get_hb_font_with_variations (plan);
385 if (gdef->has_var_store ())
386 {
387 var_store = &(gdef->get_var_store ());
388 store_cache = var_store->create_cache ();
389 }
390 }
391
392 OT::hb_collect_variation_indices_context_t c (&varidx_set,
393 &plan->layout_variation_idx_delta_map,
394 font, var_store,
395 &plan->_glyphset_gsub,
396 &plan->gpos_lookups,
397 store_cache);
398 gdef->collect_variation_indices (c: &c);
399
400 if (hb_ot_layout_has_positioning (face: plan->source))
401 gpos->collect_variation_indices (c: &c);
402
403 hb_font_destroy (font);
404 var_store->destroy_cache (cache: store_cache);
405
406 gdef->remap_layout_variation_indices (layout_variation_indices: &varidx_set, layout_variation_idx_delta_map: &plan->layout_variation_idx_delta_map);
407
408 unsigned subtable_count = gdef->has_var_store () ? gdef->get_var_store ().get_sub_table_count () : 0;
409 _generate_varstore_inner_maps (varidx_set, subtable_count, inner_maps&: plan->gdef_varstore_inner_maps);
410
411 gdef.destroy ();
412 gpos.destroy ();
413}
414#endif
415
416static inline void
417_cmap_closure (hb_face_t *face,
418 const hb_set_t *unicodes,
419 hb_set_t *glyphset)
420{
421 OT::cmap::accelerator_t cmap (face);
422 cmap.table->closure_glyphs (unicodes, glyphset);
423}
424
425static void _colr_closure (hb_face_t *face,
426 hb_map_t *layers_map,
427 hb_map_t *palettes_map,
428 hb_set_t *glyphs_colred)
429{
430 OT::COLR::accelerator_t colr (face);
431 if (!colr.is_valid ()) return;
432
433 hb_set_t palette_indices, layer_indices;
434 // Collect all glyphs referenced by COLRv0
435 hb_set_t glyphset_colrv0;
436 for (hb_codepoint_t gid : *glyphs_colred)
437 colr.closure_glyphs (glyph: gid, related_ids: &glyphset_colrv0);
438
439 glyphs_colred->union_ (other: glyphset_colrv0);
440
441 //closure for COLRv1
442 colr.closure_forV1 (glyphset: glyphs_colred, layer_indices: &layer_indices, palette_indices: &palette_indices);
443
444 colr.closure_V0palette_indices (glyphs: glyphs_colred, palettes: &palette_indices);
445 _remap_indexes (indexes: &layer_indices, mapping: layers_map);
446 _remap_palette_indexes (palette_indexes: &palette_indices, mapping: palettes_map);
447}
448
449static inline void
450_math_closure (hb_subset_plan_t *plan,
451 hb_set_t *glyphset)
452{
453 hb_blob_ptr_t<OT::MATH> math = plan->source_table<OT::MATH> ();
454 if (math->has_data ())
455 math->closure_glyphs (glyph_set: glyphset);
456 math.destroy ();
457}
458
459
460static inline void
461_remove_invalid_gids (hb_set_t *glyphs,
462 unsigned int num_glyphs)
463{
464 glyphs->del_range (a: num_glyphs, HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID);
465}
466
467static void
468_populate_unicodes_to_retain (const hb_set_t *unicodes,
469 const hb_set_t *glyphs,
470 hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
471{
472 OT::cmap::accelerator_t cmap (plan->source);
473 unsigned size_threshold = plan->source->get_num_glyphs ();
474 if (glyphs->is_empty () && unicodes->get_population () < size_threshold)
475 {
476
477 const hb_map_t* unicode_to_gid = nullptr;
478 if (plan->accelerator)
479 unicode_to_gid = &plan->accelerator->unicode_to_gid;
480
481 // This is approach to collection is faster, but can only be used if glyphs
482 // are not being explicitly added to the subset and the input unicodes set is
483 // not excessively large (eg. an inverted set).
484 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.alloc (size: unicodes->get_population ());
485 if (!unicode_to_gid) {
486 for (hb_codepoint_t cp : *unicodes)
487 {
488 hb_codepoint_t gid;
489 if (!cmap.get_nominal_glyph (unicode: cp, glyph: &gid))
490 {
491 DEBUG_MSG(SUBSET, nullptr, "Drop U+%04X; no gid", cp);
492 continue;
493 }
494
495 plan->codepoint_to_glyph->set (key: cp, value&: gid);
496 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.push (v: hb_pair (a&: cp, b&: gid));
497 }
498 } else {
499 // Use in memory unicode to gid map it's faster then looking up from
500 // the map. This code is mostly duplicated from above to avoid doing
501 // conditionals on the presence of the unicode_to_gid map each
502 // iteration.
503 for (hb_codepoint_t cp : *unicodes)
504 {
505 hb_codepoint_t gid = unicode_to_gid->get (key: cp);
506 if (gid == HB_MAP_VALUE_INVALID)
507 {
508 DEBUG_MSG(SUBSET, nullptr, "Drop U+%04X; no gid", cp);
509 continue;
510 }
511
512 plan->codepoint_to_glyph->set (key: cp, value&: gid);
513 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.push (v: hb_pair (a&: cp, b&: gid));
514 }
515 }
516 }
517 else
518 {
519 // This approach is slower, but can handle adding in glyphs to the subset and will match
520 // them with cmap entries.
521
522 hb_map_t unicode_glyphid_map_storage;
523 hb_set_t cmap_unicodes_storage;
524 const hb_map_t* unicode_glyphid_map = &unicode_glyphid_map_storage;
525 const hb_set_t* cmap_unicodes = &cmap_unicodes_storage;
526
527 if (!plan->accelerator) {
528 cmap.collect_mapping (unicodes: &cmap_unicodes_storage, mapping: &unicode_glyphid_map_storage);
529 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.alloc (size: hb_min(unicodes->get_population ()
530 + glyphs->get_population (),
531 cmap_unicodes->get_population ()));
532 } else {
533 unicode_glyphid_map = &plan->accelerator->unicode_to_gid;
534 cmap_unicodes = &plan->accelerator->unicodes;
535 }
536
537 if (plan->accelerator &&
538 unicodes->get_population () < cmap_unicodes->get_population () &&
539 glyphs->get_population () < cmap_unicodes->get_population ())
540 {
541 auto &gid_to_unicodes = plan->accelerator->gid_to_unicodes;
542 for (hb_codepoint_t gid : *glyphs)
543 {
544 auto unicodes = gid_to_unicodes.get (k: gid);
545
546 for (hb_codepoint_t cp : unicodes)
547 {
548 plan->codepoint_to_glyph->set (key: cp, value&: gid);
549 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.push (v: hb_pair (a&: cp, b&: gid));
550 }
551 }
552 for (hb_codepoint_t cp : *unicodes)
553 {
554 /* Don't double-add entry. */
555 if (plan->codepoint_to_glyph->has (key: cp))
556 continue;
557
558 hb_codepoint_t gid = (*unicode_glyphid_map)[cp];
559 plan->codepoint_to_glyph->set (key: cp, value&: gid);
560 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.push (v: hb_pair (a&: cp, b&: gid));
561 }
562 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.qsort ();
563 }
564 else
565 {
566 for (hb_codepoint_t cp : *cmap_unicodes)
567 {
568 hb_codepoint_t gid = (*unicode_glyphid_map)[cp];
569 if (!unicodes->has (k: cp) && !glyphs->has (k: gid))
570 continue;
571
572 plan->codepoint_to_glyph->set (key: cp, value&: gid);
573 plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list.push (v: hb_pair (a&: cp, b&: gid));
574 }
575 }
576
577 /* Add gids which where requested, but not mapped in cmap */
578 for (hb_codepoint_t gid : *glyphs)
579 {
580 if (gid >= plan->source->get_num_glyphs ())
581 break;
582 plan->_glyphset_gsub.add (g: gid);
583 }
584 }
585
586 auto &arr = plan->unicode_to_new_gid_list;
587 if (arr.length)
588 {
589 plan->unicodes.add_sorted_array (array: &arr.arrayZ->first, count: arr.length, stride: sizeof (*arr.arrayZ));
590 plan->_glyphset_gsub.add_array (array: &arr.arrayZ->second, count: arr.length, stride: sizeof (*arr.arrayZ));
591 }
592}
593
594#ifndef HB_COMPOSITE_OPERATIONS_PER_GLYPH
595#define HB_COMPOSITE_OPERATIONS_PER_GLYPH 64
596#endif
597
598static unsigned
599_glyf_add_gid_and_children (const OT::glyf_accelerator_t &glyf,
600 hb_codepoint_t gid,
601 hb_set_t *gids_to_retain,
602 int operation_count,
603 unsigned depth = 0)
604{
605 if (unlikely (depth++ > HB_MAX_NESTING_LEVEL)) return operation_count;
606 if (unlikely (--operation_count < 0)) return operation_count;
607 /* Check if is already visited */
608 if (gids_to_retain->has (k: gid)) return operation_count;
609
610 gids_to_retain->add (g: gid);
611
612 for (auto item : glyf.glyph_for_gid (gid).get_composite_iterator ())
613 operation_count =
614 _glyf_add_gid_and_children (glyf,
615 gid: item.get_gid (),
616 gids_to_retain,
617 operation_count,
618 depth);
619
620 return operation_count;
621}
622
623static void
624_populate_gids_to_retain (hb_subset_plan_t* plan,
625 hb_set_t* drop_tables)
626{
627 OT::glyf_accelerator_t glyf (plan->source);
628#ifndef HB_NO_SUBSET_CFF
629 OT::cff1::accelerator_t cff (plan->source);
630#endif
631
632 plan->_glyphset_gsub.add (g: 0); // Not-def
633
634 _cmap_closure (face: plan->source, unicodes: &plan->unicodes, glyphset: &plan->_glyphset_gsub);
635
636#ifndef HB_NO_SUBSET_LAYOUT
637 if (!drop_tables->has (HB_OT_TAG_GSUB))
638 // closure all glyphs/lookups/features needed for GSUB substitutions.
639 _closure_glyphs_lookups_features<GSUB> (
640 plan,
641 gids_to_retain: &plan->_glyphset_gsub,
642 lookups: &plan->gsub_lookups,
643 features: &plan->gsub_features,
644 langsys_map: &plan->gsub_langsys,
645 feature_record_cond_idx_map: &plan->gsub_feature_record_cond_idx_map,
646 feature_substitutes_map: &plan->gsub_feature_substitutes_map);
647
648 if (!drop_tables->has (HB_OT_TAG_GPOS))
649 _closure_glyphs_lookups_features<GPOS> (
650 plan,
651 gids_to_retain: &plan->_glyphset_gsub,
652 lookups: &plan->gpos_lookups,
653 features: &plan->gpos_features,
654 langsys_map: &plan->gpos_langsys,
655 feature_record_cond_idx_map: &plan->gpos_feature_record_cond_idx_map,
656 feature_substitutes_map: &plan->gpos_feature_substitutes_map);
657#endif
658 _remove_invalid_gids (glyphs: &plan->_glyphset_gsub, num_glyphs: plan->source->get_num_glyphs ());
659
660 plan->_glyphset_mathed = plan->_glyphset_gsub;
661 if (!drop_tables->has (HB_OT_TAG_MATH))
662 {
663 _math_closure (plan, glyphset: &plan->_glyphset_mathed);
664 _remove_invalid_gids (glyphs: &plan->_glyphset_mathed, num_glyphs: plan->source->get_num_glyphs ());
665 }
666
667 hb_set_t cur_glyphset = plan->_glyphset_mathed;
668 if (!drop_tables->has (HB_OT_TAG_COLR))
669 {
670 _colr_closure (face: plan->source, layers_map: &plan->colrv1_layers, palettes_map: &plan->colr_palettes, glyphs_colred: &cur_glyphset);
671 _remove_invalid_gids (glyphs: &cur_glyphset, num_glyphs: plan->source->get_num_glyphs ());
672 }
673
674 plan->_glyphset_colred = cur_glyphset;
675
676 /* Populate a full set of glyphs to retain by adding all referenced
677 * composite glyphs. */
678 if (glyf.has_data ())
679 for (hb_codepoint_t gid : cur_glyphset)
680 _glyf_add_gid_and_children (glyf, gid, gids_to_retain: &plan->_glyphset,
681 operation_count: cur_glyphset.get_population () * HB_COMPOSITE_OPERATIONS_PER_GLYPH);
682 else
683 plan->_glyphset.union_ (other: cur_glyphset);
684#ifndef HB_NO_SUBSET_CFF
685 if (!plan->accelerator || plan->accelerator->has_seac)
686 {
687 bool has_seac = false;
688 if (cff.is_valid ())
689 for (hb_codepoint_t gid : cur_glyphset)
690 if (_add_cff_seac_components (cff, gid, gids_to_retain: &plan->_glyphset))
691 has_seac = true;
692 plan->has_seac = has_seac;
693 }
694#endif
695
696 _remove_invalid_gids (glyphs: &plan->_glyphset, num_glyphs: plan->source->get_num_glyphs ());
697
698
699#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
700 if (!drop_tables->has (HB_OT_TAG_GDEF))
701 _collect_layout_variation_indices (plan);
702#endif
703}
704
705static void
706_create_glyph_map_gsub (const hb_set_t* glyph_set_gsub,
707 const hb_map_t* glyph_map,
708 hb_map_t* out)
709{
710 + hb_iter (glyph_set_gsub)
711 | hb_map ([&] (hb_codepoint_t gid) {
712 return hb_pair_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_codepoint_t> (gid,
713 glyph_map->get (key: gid));
714 })
715 | hb_sink (out)
716 ;
717}
718
719static void
720_create_old_gid_to_new_gid_map (const hb_face_t *face,
721 bool retain_gids,
722 const hb_set_t *all_gids_to_retain,
723 hb_map_t *glyph_map, /* OUT */
724 hb_map_t *reverse_glyph_map, /* OUT */
725 unsigned int *num_glyphs /* OUT */)
726{
727 unsigned pop = all_gids_to_retain->get_population ();
728 reverse_glyph_map->resize (new_population: pop);
729 glyph_map->resize (new_population: pop);
730
731 if (!retain_gids)
732 {
733 + hb_enumerate (hb_iter (all_gids_to_retain), (hb_codepoint_t) 0)
734 | hb_sink (reverse_glyph_map)
735 ;
736 *num_glyphs = reverse_glyph_map->get_population ();
737 }
738 else
739 {
740 + hb_iter (all_gids_to_retain)
741 | hb_map ([] (hb_codepoint_t _) {
742 return hb_pair_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_codepoint_t> (_, _);
743 })
744 | hb_sink (reverse_glyph_map)
745 ;
746
747 hb_codepoint_t max_glyph = HB_SET_VALUE_INVALID;
748 hb_set_previous (set: all_gids_to_retain, codepoint: &max_glyph);
749
750 *num_glyphs = max_glyph + 1;
751 }
752
753 + reverse_glyph_map->iter ()
754 | hb_map (&hb_pair_t<hb_codepoint_t, hb_codepoint_t>::reverse)
755 | hb_sink (glyph_map)
756 ;
757}
758
759static void
760_nameid_closure (hb_face_t *face,
761 hb_set_t *nameids,
762 bool all_axes_pinned,
763 hb_hashmap_t<hb_tag_t, float> *user_axes_location)
764{
765#ifndef HB_NO_STYLE
766 face->table.STAT->collect_name_ids (user_axes_location, nameids_to_retain: nameids);
767#endif
768#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
769 if (!all_axes_pinned)
770 face->table.fvar->collect_name_ids (user_axes_location, nameids);
771#endif
772}
773
774#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
775static void
776_normalize_axes_location (hb_face_t *face, hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
777{
778 if (plan->user_axes_location.is_empty ())
779 return;
780
781 hb_array_t<const OT::AxisRecord> axes = face->table.fvar->get_axes ();
782 plan->normalized_coords.resize (size_: axes.length);
783
784 bool has_avar = face->table.avar->has_data ();
785 const OT::SegmentMaps *seg_maps = nullptr;
786 if (has_avar)
787 seg_maps = face->table.avar->get_segment_maps ();
788
789 bool axis_not_pinned = false;
790 unsigned old_axis_idx = 0, new_axis_idx = 0;
791 unsigned int i = 0;
792 for (const auto& axis : axes)
793 {
794 hb_tag_t axis_tag = axis.get_axis_tag ();
795 plan->axes_old_index_tag_map.set (key: old_axis_idx, value&: axis_tag);
796
797 if (!plan->user_axes_location.has (key: axis_tag))
798 {
799 axis_not_pinned = true;
800 plan->axes_index_map.set (key: old_axis_idx, value&: new_axis_idx);
801 new_axis_idx++;
802 }
803 else
804 {
805 int normalized_v = axis.normalize_axis_value (v: plan->user_axes_location.get (key: axis_tag));
806 if (has_avar && old_axis_idx < face->table.avar->get_axis_count ())
807 {
808 normalized_v = seg_maps->map (value: normalized_v);
809 }
810 plan->axes_location.set (key: axis_tag, value&: normalized_v);
811 if (normalized_v != 0)
812 plan->pinned_at_default = false;
813
814 plan->normalized_coords[i] = normalized_v;
815 }
816 if (has_avar)
817 seg_maps = &StructAfter<OT::SegmentMaps> (X: *seg_maps);
818
819 old_axis_idx++;
820
821 i++;
822 }
823 plan->all_axes_pinned = !axis_not_pinned;
824}
825#endif
826
827hb_subset_plan_t::hb_subset_plan_t (hb_face_t *face,
828 const hb_subset_input_t *input)
829{
830 successful = true;
831 flags = input->flags;
832
833 unicode_to_new_gid_list.init ();
834
835 name_ids = *input->sets.name_ids;
836 name_languages = *input->sets.name_languages;
837 layout_features = *input->sets.layout_features;
838 layout_scripts = *input->sets.layout_scripts;
839 glyphs_requested = *input->sets.glyphs;
840 drop_tables = *input->sets.drop_tables;
841 no_subset_tables = *input->sets.no_subset_tables;
842 source = hb_face_reference (face);
843 dest = hb_face_builder_create ();
844
845 codepoint_to_glyph = hb_map_create ();
846 glyph_map = hb_map_create ();
847 reverse_glyph_map = hb_map_create ();
848
849 gdef_varstore_inner_maps.init ();
850
851 user_axes_location = input->axes_location;
852 all_axes_pinned = false;
853 pinned_at_default = true;
854
855#ifdef HB_EXPERIMENTAL_API
856 for (auto _ : input->name_table_overrides)
857 {
858 hb_bytes_t name_bytes = _.second;
859 unsigned len = name_bytes.length;
860 char *name_str = (char *) hb_malloc (len);
861 if (unlikely (!check_success (name_str)))
862 break;
863
864 hb_memcpy (name_str, name_bytes.arrayZ, len);
865 name_table_overrides.set (_.first, hb_bytes_t (name_str, len));
866 }
867#endif
868
869 void* accel = hb_face_get_user_data(face, key: hb_subset_accelerator_t::user_data_key());
870
871 attach_accelerator_data = input->attach_accelerator_data;
872 force_long_loca = input->force_long_loca;
873 if (accel)
874 accelerator = (hb_subset_accelerator_t*) accel;
875
876
877 if (unlikely (in_error ()))
878 return;
879
880#ifndef HB_NO_VAR
881 _normalize_axes_location (face, plan: this);
882#endif
883
884 _populate_unicodes_to_retain (unicodes: input->sets.unicodes, glyphs: input->sets.glyphs, plan: this);
885
886 _populate_gids_to_retain (plan: this, drop_tables: input->sets.drop_tables);
887
888 _create_old_gid_to_new_gid_map (face,
889 retain_gids: input->flags & HB_SUBSET_FLAGS_RETAIN_GIDS,
890 all_gids_to_retain: &_glyphset,
891 glyph_map,
892 reverse_glyph_map,
893 num_glyphs: &_num_output_glyphs);
894
895 _create_glyph_map_gsub (
896 glyph_set_gsub: &_glyphset_gsub,
897 glyph_map,
898 out: &glyph_map_gsub);
899
900 // Now that we have old to new gid map update the unicode to new gid list.
901 for (unsigned i = 0; i < unicode_to_new_gid_list.length; i++)
902 {
903 // Use raw array access for performance.
904 unicode_to_new_gid_list.arrayZ[i].second =
905 glyph_map->get(key: unicode_to_new_gid_list.arrayZ[i].second);
906 }
907
908 _nameid_closure (face, nameids: &name_ids, all_axes_pinned, user_axes_location: &user_axes_location);
909 if (unlikely (in_error ()))
910 return;
911
912 if (attach_accelerator_data)
913 {
914 hb_multimap_t gid_to_unicodes;
915
916 hb_map_t &unicode_to_gid = *codepoint_to_glyph;
917
918 for (auto unicode : unicodes)
919 {
920 auto gid = unicode_to_gid[unicode];
921 gid_to_unicodes.add (k: gid, v: unicode);
922 }
923
924 inprogress_accelerator =
925 hb_subset_accelerator_t::create (unicode_to_gid_: *codepoint_to_glyph,
926 gid_to_unicodes_: gid_to_unicodes,
927 unicodes_: unicodes,
928 has_seac_: has_seac);
929 }
930}
931
932/**
933 * hb_subset_plan_create_or_fail:
934 * @face: font face to create the plan for.
935 * @input: a #hb_subset_input_t input.
936 *
937 * Computes a plan for subsetting the supplied face according
938 * to a provided input. The plan describes
939 * which tables and glyphs should be retained.
940 *
941 * Return value: (transfer full): New subset plan. Destroy with
942 * hb_subset_plan_destroy(). If there is a failure creating the plan
943 * nullptr will be returned.
944 *
945 * Since: 4.0.0
946 **/
947hb_subset_plan_t *
948hb_subset_plan_create_or_fail (hb_face_t *face,
949 const hb_subset_input_t *input)
950{
951 hb_subset_plan_t *plan;
952 if (unlikely (!(plan = hb_object_create<hb_subset_plan_t> (face, input))))
953 return nullptr;
954
955 if (unlikely (plan->in_error ()))
956 {
957 hb_subset_plan_destroy (plan);
958 return nullptr;
959 }
960
961 return plan;
962}
963
964/**
965 * hb_subset_plan_destroy:
966 * @plan: a #hb_subset_plan_t
967 *
968 * Decreases the reference count on @plan, and if it reaches zero, destroys
969 * @plan, freeing all memory.
970 *
971 * Since: 4.0.0
972 **/
973void
974hb_subset_plan_destroy (hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
975{
976 if (!hb_object_destroy (obj: plan)) return;
977
978 hb_free (ptr: plan);
979}
980
981/**
982 * hb_subset_plan_old_to_new_glyph_mapping:
983 * @plan: a subsetting plan.
984 *
985 * Returns the mapping between glyphs in the original font to glyphs in the
986 * subset that will be produced by @plan
987 *
988 * Return value: (transfer none):
989 * A pointer to the #hb_map_t of the mapping.
990 *
991 * Since: 4.0.0
992 **/
993hb_map_t *
994hb_subset_plan_old_to_new_glyph_mapping (const hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
995{
996 return plan->glyph_map;
997}
998
999/**
1000 * hb_subset_plan_new_to_old_glyph_mapping:
1001 * @plan: a subsetting plan.
1002 *
1003 * Returns the mapping between glyphs in the subset that will be produced by
1004 * @plan and the glyph in the original font.
1005 *
1006 * Return value: (transfer none):
1007 * A pointer to the #hb_map_t of the mapping.
1008 *
1009 * Since: 4.0.0
1010 **/
1011hb_map_t *
1012hb_subset_plan_new_to_old_glyph_mapping (const hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
1013{
1014 return plan->reverse_glyph_map;
1015}
1016
1017/**
1018 * hb_subset_plan_unicode_to_old_glyph_mapping:
1019 * @plan: a subsetting plan.
1020 *
1021 * Returns the mapping between codepoints in the original font and the
1022 * associated glyph id in the original font.
1023 *
1024 * Return value: (transfer none):
1025 * A pointer to the #hb_map_t of the mapping.
1026 *
1027 * Since: 4.0.0
1028 **/
1029hb_map_t *
1030hb_subset_plan_unicode_to_old_glyph_mapping (const hb_subset_plan_t *plan)
1031{
1032 return plan->codepoint_to_glyph;
1033}

1043 * Since: 4.0.0

1045hb_subset_plan_t *
1046hb_subset_plan_reference (hb_subset_plan_t *plan)

1048 return hb_object_reference (obj: plan);
1049}

1051/**
1052 * hb_subset_plan_set_user_data: (skip)
1053 * @plan: a #hb_subset_plan_t object.
1054 * @key: The user-data key to set
1055 * @data: A pointer to the user data
1056 * @destroy: (nullable): A callback to call when @data is not needed anymore
1057 * @replace: Whether to replace an existing data with the same key
1058 *
1059 * Attaches a user-data key/data pair to the given subset plan object.
1060 *
1061 * Return value: `true` if success, `false` otherwise
1062 *
1063 * Since: 4.0.0
1064 **/
1065hb_bool_t
1066hb_subset_plan_set_user_data (hb_subset_plan_t *plan,
1067 hb_user_data_key_t *key,
1068 void *data,
1069 hb_destroy_func_t destroy,
1070 hb_bool_t replace)
1071{
1072 return hb_object_set_user_data (obj: plan, key, data, destroy, replace);
1073}

1075/**
1076 * hb_subset_plan_get_user_data: (skip)
1077 * @plan: a #hb_subset_plan_t object.
1078 * @key: The user-data key to query
1079 *
1080 * Fetches the user data associated with the specified key,
1081 * attached to the specified subset plan object.
1082 *
1083 * Return value: (transfer none): A pointer to the user data
1084 *
1085 * Since: 4.0.0
1086 **/
1087void *
1088hb_subset_plan_get_user_data (const hb_subset_plan_t *plan,
1089 hb_user_data_key_t *key)
1090{
1091 return hb_object_get_user_data (obj: plan, key);
1092}
